data.title: Rotherham Hospice
data.meta_description: Portfolios Archive - Page 6 of 10 - Rotherham Hospice
data.text:
Susan Millard

Susan Millard

10th March 1956 - 9th June 2021

First of all I personally would like to thank all the staff who cared for my wife Sue who I loved so much. Sue was the most thoughtful, Buetiful wife, mother, grandmother, great grandmother to all of us. Sue was a insperation to many people who met her, so many relatives and friends loved her aswell a lot called her mum or gran. Lots of people have called her a legend but she was more then that to me. Sue was my wife of 48 years with no breaks & I enjoyed every second of it, but now she as been taken from me my heart is hurting so much & now my life seems so empty without her I have no idea how we are going to cope without Sues strength. If I could have changed places with Sue I definitely would have she was a much better person than me. Sue was also very straight forward she did not mix her words that were one thing that I loved about her. Rest in peace sweetheart I loved you more than words can tell. Your heartbroken hubby John.

Jonathan Ridge ‘Jonty’

Jonathan Ridge 'Jonty'

2nd January 1948 - 9th July 2016

Forever in our hearts. So dearly loved and missed always. Love Terry, Claire, Sarah and family’s xx

Shared memories of Jonathan Ridge 'Jonty'

Of my uncle Terry Walker was in hospice miss him alot he died 26th june, 2018

Linda Illsley

16th October 2019

Always loved and missed. Iris x

Joan Liversidge ‘Lambley’

Joan Liversidge 'Lambley'

29th September 1952 - 17th July 2015

My beautiful Mum who lost her battle to cancer in July 2015. We all miss and love you so much and hope that you and Oliver are looking after each other. Forever in our thoughts and hearts xxx A special thank you to the Hospice at Home team for allowing Mum to be at home with her loved ones in her final weeks.

Shared memories of Joan Liversidge 'Lambley'

Happy Mother's Day Mum & Nannan, we miss you every second. Always in our hearts & thoughts. Dawn, Chris Jacob & Chloe xxxx

Dawn Hughes

2nd March 2016

We did the memory walk for you last night Mum, raised over £500 for the hospice. Love & miss you xxx

Dawn Hughes

11th June 2016

Hazel Foster

Hazel Foster

7th November 1938 - 22nd July 2016

A message for Hazel

We knew it was a matter of time until god called your name.

In life we loved you dearly, in death we do the same.

It broke our hearts to lose you, but you didn’t go alone.

For part of us went with you the day god called you home.

You left us amazing memories,

Your love will always be our guide

And though we cannot see you

You are always at our side

Our family chain is broken

And nothing seems the same,

But as God calls us one by one

The chain will link again

Shared memories of Hazel Foster

Grandma you knew that I loved you and that I always will. You were the best grandma in the world and to me you still are. I will never forget the fun we had together, especially when we played school and dressed barbie dolls. I know you will still look out for Darcie and I, and in return we will work hard to make you proud of us. Will miss you so much Grandma Hazel. Love Evie and Darcie xxxx

Evie Buxton

29th July 2016

Every time that I smile, Every time that I sigh, I think of your face, And a tear escapes my eye. You were my world, My inspiration and my heart, But when you left me, I thought I would fall apart. You were my best friend, My one true confidante, And that's not all you were, You were also my Mum. I didn't want to live without you, But you would have wanted me to, And if there is anyone I want to make happy, That anyone is you. I would have given anything to have you back, But I know it was meant to be, For you are still watching from up there, And I know you are watching me. I will make you proud Mum, I'm going to fulfil your wish, You are going to see me and smile, That's a daughters promise. Love you always, Marie xxx

Marie Buxton

29th July 2016

A life well lived is a precious gift of hope and strength and grace, from someone who has made our world a brighter, better place. It's filled with moments, sweet and sad with smiles and sometimes tears, with friendships formed and good times shared, and laughter through the years. A life well lived is a legacy, of joy and pride and pleasure, a living, lasting memory our grateful heart's will treasure. RIP Hazel such an amazing strong woman an honour to have known you xxx

Caroline James

29th July 2016

When I met you I experienced meeting a truly loving, caring and beautiful lady. A fighter til the end. I'm so glad to have met you Hazel, a truly inspirational lady. RIP xxxxxxxxx

Lucy Barsby

29th July 2016

God looked around his garden and found an empty space, Then he looked down upon this earth and saw your tired face, he put his arms around you and lifted you to rest, Gods garden must be beautiful he only takes the best!

Nicola Connelly

29th July 2016

Those we love don't go away they walk beside us every day. Hazel - you were an inspiration to everyone who knew you and your influence lives on through Marie. You fought until the very end but always with a smile on your face and determination in your heart. Heaven gained an angel when they got you and you will continue to shine down on everyone who knew you. God bless sleep tight X X X

Andrea Lawless

29th July 2016

Many happy memories more than I could speak of but most of all a very small but inspirational and determined lady that was dignified until the end I will always remember with much love God bless you little lady xx lots of love always Nicola xxx

Nicola Connelly

30th July 2016

Hazel it was a pleasure to have known you and glad we got the opportunity to enjoy the company of yourself and Kevin last year on holiday, really sad you weren't well enough to make it this year, no more pain or suffering good night and God bless. With love Barbara & Mick xx

Barbara Mayes

31st July 2016

With deepest sympathy and happy memories especially the lovely time we all spent with you on the holiday last year, our sincere condolences to all the family. With love from The Neuro Support Group xx

Barbara Mayes

1st August 2016

Hazel was the best friend my mum could have ever wished for. We will all sadly miss her, she was always smiling no matter how she felt. She was an inspiration to others a true fighter. Not a day goes by where we don't think about her laugh and her smile. She was like part of our family. We will miss her with all our hearts.

Lisa Heydon

7th August 2016

Simply the best.

Mark Foster

29th July 2016

A strong, determined woman till the very end. A special mother-in-law whose humour in the face of adversity gave us strength. Love from Vicky X

Vicky Foster

29th July 2016

An inspiration to everyone who knew you, such a strong hearted lovley little lady, who brought laughter and smiles all round, would always turn a frown upside down! So many blessed memories were shared with such a lovley little soul, and shall never be forgotten,. Expecially holidays abroad, me with my smug little face and you rugby tackling me telling me to slap a smile on my face, things will only get better, too many fun and wonderfull memories shared with a lovley lady!! Then having Tyler and you showing how wonderfull he adored you and you adored him.. You will be missed by many, love you always.. Love me and Tyler, sweet dreams angel, and keep everyone smiling just as you would.. It was such a honour to have known such a loving,kind,caring lady as you, who always put others before herself. Love you always!! Rest in peace angel.. Forever in our hearts and thoughts, good night god bless you angel...

Rheanne Crank

29th July 2016

Those we love don't go away they walk beside us every day. Hazel when God took you he gained another angel I know you will shine down brightly on everyone who knew you because that's how you were. You were one of the most determined and strong people I knew and that lives on through Marie. You were an inspiration and a fighter till the end. Fly high Hazel. Always loved never forgotten X

Andrea Lawless

29th July 2016

My best friends mum. Hazel what can I say you were a kind person who always put others first. You were strong right til the end. Before you left us for your special place you always lived life to the full. You were an inspiration to us all. RIP lovie xxx

Jane Smedley

29th July 2016

I cried when you passed away. I still cry today. Although I love you dearly, I couldnt make you stay. A golden heart stopped beating, hard working hands at rest. God broke my heart, to prove to me that he only takes the best. That's so fitting to my grandma a hardworking loveable person. My best friend, my everything, my shoulder to cry on. No one will ever come close to replacing her. Ever. I love you so much grandma things will never be the same. I will make you proud and live everyday as if you don't know what's around the corne. As you always used to say. It's not goodbye it's until we meet again. I love you xxx

Kerry Foster

29th July 2016

Only met a couple of times but shared Marie Nick and Evie and Darcie with you! Will keep your memory alive with them! rest in peace.

Angela Buxton

31st July 2016

Hazel you were my friend, my guide, the voice of reason & most importantly my mum in law. The best ever! I love you and will miss you always. I have so many fond memories of you, holidays, get togethers & working together. I know you are looking after us all. I miss you every day & when I think of you a tear comes to my eye. Love you always xxxx

Rose Foster

1st August 2016

Remembering Hazel with love her kindness and patience to my son Steve on his visits to the Drawbridge was amazing God bless Audrey x

Audrey Gunn

1st August 2016

Doris Flower

Doris Flower 'Hedison'

15th February 1920 - 27th November 2016

Very much loved mum, nan, and great-grandma. She will be remembered by us all as a very caring member of our family. Lived a very full and varied life and enjoyed every minute of it, swimming, bowling, and dancing to name but a few of her activities.

At the age of 96 she still retained an active brain and wanted us all to be happy and love life as she had done. The care she received at Rotherham Hospice was second to none and I would urge anyone to donate to this very worthy cause. She said she felt very spoilt whilst in there and her end of life was made special. Love Wendy, John, Jo, Jayne, Mel, Jono, and all her great-grandchildren and great great-grandchildren xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

David Pearman

David Pearman

16th June 1960 - 27th September 2020

David was diagnosed with bowel cancer in April 2017. David underwent 3 major operations and had regular chemotherapy sessions. Throughout this time David always faced his challenges with courage and good spirits. He would use his sense of humour as a way of protecting those he loved from worrying about his future.

David spent 2 weeks in the Rotherham Hospice and received wonderful care, before returning home and passed away with his loving family by his side.

I met David (Dave to me) at the Tivoli night club in Rotherham in 1993 and we spent 27 happy years together. We had many wonderful holidays with family and friends during this time and it is these happy memories which I will now try to focus upon in the years to come.

Your loving partner, Diane.

Shared memories of David Pearman

"I met Dave at a hotel in Spain some 38 years ago he was there with his friend Ross, it was such a chance meeting as he must have been at the bar and nipped to the toilet, then at that point me and my friend Tony entered the bar and took the seats they were sitting in Dave came back looked at us and said in typical Yorkshire accent your right from that moment we stayed in touch and holidayed together, more so my friend Tony as I shortly having returned from this holiday moved to Cornwall. Dave loved his holidays to Spain and Turkey and many other places, well me although I joined Dave several times on holiday my great love was cruising. I'm, sure he used to dread me trying to convince Dianne to take a cruise because as Dave said I can get four holidays for that we did have a laugh about it, and that was Dave great sense of humour, but he had a serious side to particularly if money was mentioned he would drag us from bar to bar always remember were the cheapest bar was and that's the Yorkshire spirit I loved about him. So sorry to hear of his passing, they say time is a great healer, but memories will last a lifetime R.I.P."

Kevin Fentham

18th November 2020

"Dave was one of my best friends & we met 38 years ago along with my friend Kev, who has also left a message on the memory page. Dave has been a fantastic friend over all that time & we shared many a weekend together at his & Dianne's house in Swinton, at my house in Birmingham & away in Cornwall & many other destinations in the UK. We also had many years going abroad together to lots of destinations around Europe. His favourites were Turkey & Majorca. We always had a fun time & plenty of drink was involved. Dave was originally from Rotherham & in his early days used to stay at his mom & dad's house & go out with the lads for are weekend sessions. Other friends used to join me & Dave welcomed them all with open arms. He was always friendly with everyone. I got to know his family & Dianne's family & have become good friends with them all & they always made me feel welcome. Dave & i had the same sense of humour & always had a good laugh together. We both loved football, plus many other sports, including horse racing. Dave used come to mine & stop so he could go & watch his beloved Rotherham United, even sitting with myself & the Birmingham fans on one occasion. Dave was fantastic with finances & helped me understand my pension & got me into the position i am in today & will be forever grateful to him. He also help helped friends & family with theirs & i know they feel the same too. Dave will be greatly missed by me, as he was a dear friend, mate for life & a top bloke. I will always miss my buddy but will always be in my thoughts. God bless you m8! Forever brothers!"

Anthony Village

23rd November 2020

"Dave was a special friend to me, ever since we met 38 years ago, on holiday in Majorca, with my friend Kev & the others we were away with. We have been the best of mates since, spending many weekends & holidays away together. For many of those years, he was with his partner Dianne, who he loved dearly& her kids, Robert & Catherine, who he treated like his own. He loved his sport & was an avid Rotherham United fan & season ticket holder. He also travelled to away matches & used to come to my team's Birmingham City's ground, also sitting with myself in the Birmingham stands. He loved my most sports & we used to go to horse race meetings with Dianne & the lads. We both had the same sense of humour & loved having a laugh at just about anything. He helped me with my finances along with others, he wanted the best for everybody. I became good friends with his family over the years & made many good friends, through him. I will miss Dave so much, has was a great friend & special person."

Anthony Village

23rd November 2020

"I first met Dave at the physique Gym in town, then started going out with other members on Friday nights them me and Dave had a ritual Friday night Prince of Wales then Tivoli night club. Saturday pub crawl round town few away days Benidorm, Blackpool Rotherham away games good times. Dave always made me laugh the more he drank the bigger the grin. then he met and fell for Diana the rest is history. We lost contact for many years then out of the blue he was sat in his car in Lidl car park windows down we started chatting away later that night Dave phone and we had a long conversation for 1 hour + just talking about old times. Dave never mentioned his illness during our conversation and I promised to keep in touch ( thinking about it now, so brave of him not to tell me of his problems so we could giggle and smile and not making it a sad phone conversation ) Then the phone call from Diana Sandra and I could not believe he had passed away. After all those years and then Meeting and talking and now he's gone again so sad. I would like to thank Diana who is one of the nicest people one could ever meet allowing a few but not enough words in this memory book RIP Dave who knows one day we might have that beer together."

Dave Roberts

11th December 2020

"I got to know Dave from work, we use to car share from Chesterfield was always pointing birds out as we went back up the M1. We used to do a pub crawl from the gate Inn down into Swinton making sure we finished in the butcher's arms for the oap karaoke which he loved.Thanks for being a good mate, will always remember the laughs and good times we had. RIP pal."

Martin Danylkiw

15th December 2020

Christine Herring ‘Chris’

Christine Herring 'Chris'

1st January 1970 - 24th January 2016

Dear Christine, thank you for being my special friend I loved you dearly. When you burst through nursery doors back in 2005 I knew then I had met a very special lady to the day you passed away.

We have shared very special times together for example you attending my wedding love you always Nina Steel xxxxxx

Brian Newbolt

Brian Newbolt

4th June 1937 - 11th January 2017

A loving and devoted husband to Marjorie for 60 years, a caring family man, father to Sharron, Steven, Ann, Kathryn, and Jill, father in law to Ian, Kate, and Andy, grandfather to 13, and great grandfather to 11 children who all loved him immensely. There might have been a raised eyebrow but he was always there to support.

A shoulder for babies to sleep on, a shoulder for us to cry on; it didn’t matter what troubles you brought to his door he always listened and would give you the shirt off your back to make things better.

The Henshaw family’s story

The Henshaw family's story

Patient and Family Stories

Victoria Henshaw was not only a much loved wife, mother and daughter, but an amazing lady who achieved so much in her life both on a personal and professional level. A town centre manager turned urban academic, Victoria devoted her life to an aspect of cities that is entirely invisible, but which she was convinced had a huge influence over how we perceive places – namely, their smell. She achieved the successful publication of her book “Urban Smellscapes”, and had begun preparation of a second book which is now being completed by her colleagues.

In 2014, Victoria received the news that she had cancer. She was cared for by the Hospice at Home team, before being admitted to the Inpatient Unit on 19th September 2014. Victoria’s family visited daily and were impressed with the peacefulness of the Hospice surroundings, and the privacy and dignity shown to Victoria.

Whilst being cared for in the Hospice, Victoria urged her sons Brodie, Alistair and Oliver to take part in the Colour Assault to give something back to the Hospice. The boys set up an online fundraising page, setting themselves a fundraising target of £300, and asked family and friends to sponsor them. Imagine their delight when their fundraising reached over £5,000!

Sadly, only a few weeks after the Colour Assault, Victoria passed away at home. We are extremely grateful to the family for their support of Rotherham Hospice and we wish them all the very best for the future.

How can you help?

There are many ways you can support us, whether it be through holding an event, playing in our lottery, volunteering, or donating!
